title.narrative: COVID-19 Crisis Relief & Support in India

description.narrative: This Donation Drive will help migrated and marginalised communities affected from Coronavirus in India by providing them food, ration, community protection kit containing dettol, sanitary pads, detergents, soap, hand towel, Cooked and uncooked foods etc. Your donation will also help to protect our community Health workers, Doctors, Nurses in India who visits households on daily basis for information dissemination, linking COVID-19 suspected cases with testing and relief activities.

organisation.narrative: Hindustan Latex Family Planning Promotion Trust

mailing-address.narrative: Sharad Agarwal, B-14 A, 2nd floor, Block-B, Sector-62, Gautam Budh Nagar, Noida, Uttar Pradesh 201307, India

title.narrative: Coronavirus Women-led Small Business Support Fund

description.narrative: This project will help fund 750 women and girls-led small business either as support for struggling businesses due to lock-downs in communities or to help new business as opportunities due to the pandemic comes up. We will provide support to very poor, economically struggling women and girls and aim to improve their social and economic situations amidst this difficult times.

organisation.narrative: Women's Action Against Climate Change Association

mailing-address.narrative: Michelle Uy, Barrio Talisayan, Albuera, Leyte, Ormoc, Leyte 6542, Philippines

description.narrative: The project will distribute 70 tip-tap water cans in the slums of Bwaise to help reduce the spread of Covid 19, raise awareness on the importance of hand washing and the ways of spread and preventive measure in the local language will been done door to door.

mailing-address.narrative: somero Uganda, Bwaise Mukalazi Kawempe Kampala Uganda, kampala, None, Uganda

title.narrative: COVID-19: Protect 5000 Poor People in India

description.narrative: Widowed at the age of 23, Revathi had gathered the pieces of her life to look after her 3 children. With a small tea shop that she had set up in a slum, she could barely manage to feed her kids. Fate dealt her a further blow as due to Covid-19 lockdown, that shop had to close down. Like her, all unskilled workers and small time sellers have also lost their jobs. As Covid19 strikes India, Prajna Foundation has now turned its attention to saving this most vulnerable section of the society.

organisation.narrative: PRAJNA Foundation for Cultural Interaction and Studies

mailing-address.narrative: Marianne Drysdale, 206 RAJ TOWER-1,, ALAKNANDA COMM CENTRE,, New Delhi, DELHI 110019, India

title.narrative: Helping U.S. Veterans and their families COVID-19

description.narrative: COVID-19 Relief Program for emergency financial assistance to all Veterans, Active Duty, Reserves and National Guard, A Global Pandemic calls for an unprecedented response from those who can give. Thousands of Veterans and their families are affected financially. Thru our partnership with the Yellow Ribbon Network, we are helping thousands of Veterans and their families with financial assistance such as Mortgage Payments, Housing Rent Payments, Car Payments, adaptive housing, and Utilities.

mailing-address.narrative: DAVID CANCEL, 24841 Sw 121ST Pl, Homestead, FL 33032, United States

description.narrative: As Atlanta Mission continues to care for men, women, and children experiencing homelessness amidst concerns of COVID-19, the health and safety of our staff and clients are our top priority. We are continuously taking proactive measures in adherence with CDC and Department of Health guidelines. We are confronting these uncertain times as a community united.

mailing-address.narrative: Toni Dixon, 2353 Bolton Rd Nw, Atlanta, GA 30318, United States

title.narrative: I take care of myself to take care of others

description.narrative: Caring is a demanding job; it requieres a huge effort. In this stage of isolation to prevent COVID 19 from spreading, the caregivers of our children have had to increase their days of living together and caring for children. Therefore, at CRAN we have designed an accompaniment process to care for our caregivers and promote in them the importance of maintaining their emotional, mental and physical well-being to guarantee the best conditions to take care of themselves and our children.

mailing-address.narrative: Camila Leyva, Transversal 77 162-06, Bogota, Bogota 111156, Colombia

title.narrative: LGBTQAI+ SAFE HOUSE IN THE COVID PANDEMIC

description.narrative: This project will help pay for a safe house that will house about 50+ lgbtqai+ individuals below 35 years of age.With the harsh conditions that LGBTQAI+ individuals face in Zimbabwe, it has come to light after the rise of the Covid pandemic that these individuals are highly affected as they survive on a hand to mouth wage and with covid lockdown there is now hunger, depression and the rise of suicide cases, already the lgbtqai+ is a thinning margin, we need a hand in making life worthy for them.

organisation.narrative: I REACH OUT MY HAND AFRICA

mailing-address.narrative: Tyrone Havnar, 84 Paarl farm, Selous, Chegutu, mash central 00000, Zimbabwe

title.narrative: COVID-19: Bring Hope to the elderly and vulnerable

description.narrative: LEAP Africa is responding to the pandemic by supporting the most vulnerable in Nigeria, working through our social entrepreneurs who are at the frontline of providing relief to the poorest communities who have been hardest hit by the crisis. The interventions are catering to the welfare and wellbeing of these low-income families in three broad areas: Food supplies and toiletries, Personal Protective Equipment (PPE), and sensitization. Join us to scale the intervention activities in Nigeria.

mailing-address.narrative: Bernard Ibelih, 13 Omorinre Johnson Street, Off Admiralty Way, Lekki Phase 1, Lagos, Lagos P.O.Box 75427, Nigeria

description.narrative: Gram Vikas Trust is providing at least 10,000 daily wage workers & land less families with food to prevent hunger being the biggest killer during the Corona virus pandemic.

title.narrative: Help the vulnerable fight coronavirus in Japan

description.narrative: This project will produce chlorine-based disinfectant for distribution to 300 needy institutions and the vulnerable they serve, in areas such as Tokyo and Osaka, where emergency declarations have been made. These institutions include hospitals, clinics, homes for the elderly, handicapped service agencies, mentally handicapped service agencies, day care centers, nursing homes, home care nursing service agencies, orphanages, kindergartens, child care centers and those serving the homeless.

mailing-address.narrative: Donald Thomson, 1-37-7 Kamisakuragi, Tomiya Shi, Miyagi Ken 981-3328, Japan

title.narrative: Boys & Girls Club South Coast Area COVID-19 Relief

description.narrative: The Boys & Girls Club of the South Coast Area in San Clemente, CA is dedicated to supporting our community during the COVID-19 pandemic. Though we had to close our doors on March 16 for the safety of all, that very same day we launched our Emergency Food program, delivering meals, food staples, and activities to families in need. To date, we have served over 5,000 meals. We are also providing virtual programming for our members and are prepared to open our summer camp as soon as it is safe.

organisation.narrative: Boys and Girls Club of the South Coast Area

mailing-address.narrative: Elizabeth Beas, 1304 Calle Valle, San Clemente, CA 92672, United States

title.narrative: Dare to Care Kentucky COVID-19 Response

description.narrative: Dare to Care Food Bank is closely following developments with the COVID-19 challenge, especially for individuals who are food insecure. We prioritize the health and safety of our Kentuckiana community, volunteers, and staff, and we are taking extra precautions to safely respond to increased food needs during this time.

mailing-address.narrative: Emily Essex, 5803 Fern Valley Road, Louisville, KY 40228, United States

description.narrative: This project will support Nurture Africa to test 20,000 community members for COVID-19 over a 4 month period, commencing 27th April 2020. Funding will be used to provide Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) for all staff to mitigate the risk of exposure. Each person testing positive for COVID-19 will be isolated and receive treatment at Nurture Africa's health centre until fully recovered in order to reduce community transmission and protect vulnerable groups; especially our HIV infected clients

mailing-address.narrative: Kevin Murphy, 54 Pembroke Road, Dublin 4, Dublin, Ireland

description.narrative: The coronavirus pandemic is having an unprecedented impact on our finances. Though it is hard to predict how far-reaching the consequences will be, this will affect our ability to continue all of our work and to help animals in need. However with Covid-19 undeniably impacting captive facilities, demand for our work to help end animal suffering is only increasing. We are doing everything we can to mitigate the impact on the animals and communities we help, but need your help now.

mailing-address.narrative: Victoria Fanthorpe, 1 - 7 Station Road, Crawley, West Sussex RH10 1HT, United Kingdom

title.narrative: Building Virtual Bridges to Connect Refugee Youth

description.narrative: The Virtual Bridges Initiative will provide refugee youth in Colombia, Uganda, Bangladesh and Jordan with online arts-based educational programming that allows participants to connect with peers and refugee artist mentors around the world who are eager to teach, learn and collaborate on creative art making projects - a powerful remedy to the social isolation and purposelessness felt by many youth living in refugee settlements, especially during the COVID-19 pandemic.

mailing-address.narrative: Joel Bergner, 601 W 26th Street, Suite 325-28, New York, NY 10001, United States

title.narrative: Gardens Grow Food for Families During COVID-19

description.narrative: SPI will provide vegetable seed to ensure that thousands of families and communities can grow their own food while following stay-at-home orders during the Coronavirus pandemic. In partnership locations like the Pine Ridge Reservation in South Dakota USA, rural Guatemala, and South Sudan, hunger was ever present and will grow during the current recession. Unemployment and social distancing are driving massive interest in home gardening, and there's not enough home garden seed to go around.

mailing-address.narrative: Greg Bonin, PO Box 9163, Asheville, NC 28815, United States

title.narrative: Solidarity and Care in times of COVID-19

description.narrative: Because of the health emergency by COVID-19, the Colombian government established confinement measures in homes. For the families that are linked to the informal economy, this means that they do not have the possibility to work. The PT Foundation cover about 80 families; people who are dependent on the informal work sectors. If you would like to support them, you can show solidarity by providing food and medicine. This will give relief to these families, taking care of them with dignified life.

mailing-address.narrative: Luz Stella Talero, Cra 86 G #40-60 Sur, Bogota, Bogota DC 110881, Colombia

description.narrative: This pandemic has not changed our mission but has changed our method. El Shaddai continues to be committed to providing hot meals to the poor, homeless and daily workers. The money raised will be used to feed one-time cooked meals for more than 1000 poor families per day. We have identified the needy across Goa to donate the groceries as government-based rations are being looted.

mailing-address.narrative: Julia Matthew, H. No. 251, Socol Waddo,, Assagao, Bardez, Mapusa, Goa 403507, India

description.narrative: Help 240 children and adults with disabilities get food, medicines and essential supplies during the COVID-19 pandemic. The residents at all 4 branches of Prithipura Communities are particularly vulnerable to the effects of this virus. We've had a dramatic drop in donations since the crisis started. This project aims to fill that funding gap and keep everyone here safe and well.

mailing-address.narrative: Katherine de Kretser, Prithipura Communities, Prithipura Infants Home, Beach Road, Hendala, Western Province 11300, Sri Lanka

description.narrative: Ramadan 2020 is almost upon us and it is a time for the generous and the wealthy to start supporting underserved communities in Lebanon. In Ramadan, people fast from dust till dawn, and through this project, we will be providing impoverished families with hot meals and food parcels to survive this month, mainly during the economic crisis and the coronavirus outbreak in Lebanon which has left them with no support.

organisation.narrative: Union of Relief and Development Associations

mailing-address.narrative: Hanine Yousef, Mount Lebanon, khaldeh, behind Al Rammal Supermarket , Al Anwar building, ground floor, Beirut, 5362, Lebanon

description.narrative: Operation Mercy is responding directly in COVID 19 affected communities in 10 countries in Central Asia, The Middle East and North Africa. From developing a COVID 19 children's book in Dari and Pashto in Afghanistan, Training of Trainers of local community organisations in Tajikistan, over delivery of food support to the most vulnerable in Kazakhstan, distribution of hygiene kits and hygiene lessons in refugee camps in Iraq, all combined with emotional support.This project has a wide impact.

mailing-address.narrative: Andrea Vogt, Grusgropsvagen 5, Orebro, SE-70236, Sweden

description.narrative: This project will provide financial and technical support for 750 small business affected by the Coronavirus pandemic so that they are able to re-start their business and be economically active again. The financial support will be used in order to purchase equipment, buy new inventories, re-hire laid-off workers, renovate commercial spaces, among others.

organisation.narrative: Water, Agroforestry, Nutrition and Development Foundation

mailing-address.narrative: Cora Sayre, Libertad, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental 9021, Philippines

title.narrative: Essential Supplies to Fight COVID-19 in Uganda

description.narrative: This funding will help us buy and supply essential needs like food, soap and locally made masks to our direct beneficiaries and their families totaling to 240 people, who have been affected by the COVID-19, due to the fact that their type of work is hand to mouth earning. We also get our earned revenue from the entertainment industry, we stopped earning in February and our lock down has been temporarily extended up to May. No one is certain about tomorrow and sure when this will end.

mailing-address.narrative: Brian Ssozi, Mutundwe, Kampala, 0000, Uganda

title.narrative: Support Arab women's needs in the COVID-19 crisis

description.narrative: The COVID-19 crisis is particularly challenging for Palestinian women. Kayan is empowering grassroots Palestinian women leaders to respond to community needs. In a full needs assessment, the grassroots leaders decided it was critical to support women, especially single mothers and domestic, informal workers, with basic supplies (food, medicine, and hygienic products), emotional support, and connections to critical resources like domestic violence protection, and economic support services.

mailing-address.narrative: Mona Mohajneh, 118 Arlozorov St., Haifa, 33276, Israel

title.narrative: Guiding the Blind through the COVID-19 Pandemic

description.narrative: Blind people are especially vulnerable to the Corona virus. They rely on touch to read Braille and to navigate unfamiliar surroundings. They also need people to assist and guide them - so social distancing is really not easy. In South Africa most Blind people are unemployed - making them susceptible to malnutrition and low immunity and at greater risk of contracting the virus. This emergency project aims to feed and equip as many Blind people with the basic necessities to keep them safe.

mailing-address.narrative: Anne-Marie Stephenson, 58 (b) Kirkwood Street, North End, Port Elizabeth, Eastern Cape 6001, South Africa

title.narrative: Protect People with Disabilities against COVID-19

description.narrative: MAITS' digital COVID response programme will provide life-saving techniques to reduce the risk of respiratory infections in children and adults with disabilities around the world, preventing hospitalisation & infection; providing physiotherapy and mental health support for those with special needs during lockdown. As Coronavirus spreads worldwide, it is critical that we continue to reach the most vulnerable in resource-poor settings, ensuring no child or adult with disabilities gets left behind.

organisation.narrative: MAITS - Multi-Agency International Training and Support

mailing-address.narrative: Emma Richards, 86/87 Wimpole Street, London, W1G 9RL, United Kingdom

title.narrative: Grandmothers and teachers together for education

description.narrative: As a result of COVID-19, will children have lost eight months of school. In response to this tragic situation, grandmothers and teachers will join hands in a summer learning program to support children in rural southern Senegal. GMP aims to expand its innovative Summer Learning Program to fill the gap caused by COVID-19. 32 teachers and grandmothers will organize a fun program of traditional games and stories combined with a robust review of French and Math before school restarts in the fall.

mailing-address.narrative: Alyssa Rychtarik, 11 Magnolia Parkway, Chevy Chase, MD 20815, United States

description.narrative: This project will help 4 health centres in Wakiso District in Uganda deal with the coronavirus pandemic through providing handwashing facilities, PPE and spreading effective hygiene messaging. We will also carry out a campaign of hygiene awareness in the surrounding rural villages through house to house trainings. With your support we can reach 130,000 people and reduce the spread of Covid-19 and dramatically improve people's long term health through better hygiene practices.

mailing-address.narrative: Brendan Hanlon, Reed Exhibitions Gateway House, 28 The Quadrant, Richmond, Surrey TW9 1DN, United Kingdom

title.narrative: Support for the COVID-19 prevention and control

description.narrative: Day labor, distress women including persons with Disabilities in Bangladesh. Planning, measuring and counting to implement adequate service delivery in action on free health instrument services as well as food distribution services. Employing more staff in the office. Also by assisting Government in social service as well. Post: Raihanpur under district of Barguna at Barishal Divisions of Bangladesh

title.narrative: Protecting Thai elephants from COVID-19 effects

description.narrative: COVID-19 has a devastating impact on tourism in Thailand, putting the lives of captive elephants in danger. A drastic reduction in income has seen many venues struggle to feed and care for their elephants. Without our immediate help, these captive elephants are at risk of malnutrition and death by starvation. We aim to provide struggling elephant venues with food, supplements and medicine. We have identified six higher welfare venues with a total of 60 elephant residents where we can help.

organisation.narrative: World Animal Protection Fund Netherlands (Formerly WSPA)

mailing-address.narrative: Moniek Poerstamper, Louis Couperusplein 2, Den Haag, Zuid Holland 2514 HP, Netherlands

description.narrative: Water Relief project aims to provide free water supply of clean and drinkable water at home to vulnerable and low income families during lockdown. Water security at home means each family member will meet the Water Survival Threshold defined by SPHERE Humanitarian Response as the daily minimum water requirement of 15-20L per person. This will also boost good handwashing practices, personal hygiene and sanitation at home which are the most effective means to prevent the spread of COVID-19 virus.

organisation.narrative: E&V Water and Life Philippines Inc.

mailing-address.narrative: Lea Loreen Sacay, 3J Unit 3rd Floor Chua Tiam Building, Cebu, 6014, Philippines

description.narrative: The Covid-19 pandemic is affecting all sectors in Vietnam, including grassroots nonprofit organizations. We foresee that local nonprofits will face a challenging year for operations and fundraising in 2020. LIN's Covid-19 Community Fund is set up to support local nonprofits that are directly or indirectly affected by the Covid-19 pandemic. This Community Fund will be distributed to organizations in need and LIN will keep you informed on the organizations which receive the fund.

mailing-address.narrative: LIN Center, 63A Nguyen Cu street, Thao Dien Ward, District 2, Ho Chi Minh City, NA NA, Vietnam

title.narrative: Support Children Orphaned by Aids in Johannesburg

description.narrative: On 5 March, South Africa confirmed its first case of COVID-19 a 38-year-old man who returned from Italy on Sunday. Your donation will support vulnerable HIV/AIDS orphans and their grandmothers in Johannesburg South, who need essential items such as soap, water, medicine and food, while keeping the community safe from abuse and violence. We are working together with our communities to help mitigate the spread of COVID-19.

mailing-address.narrative: Samuel Lumu, 184 Church St, Keneliworth, Turffontein, Johannesburg, Gauteng 2190, South Africa

title.narrative: COVID-19 Relief for orphan Children and Youths

description.narrative: The ongoing lockdown, in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic, has affected the lives of some of the most vulnerable communities across India, including deprived and orphan children. The lockdown has not been easy for any of us, especially children. We, at El Shaddai are taking care of 150 children in our homes by ensuring their access to essentials such as soaps, masks, sanitizers, and study kits to have online classes for the children and basic necessities such as shelter, food, and clothing.

title.narrative: Relief Fund for Coronavirus Pandemic Victims

description.narrative: This project will provide time-critical help to the most vulnerable people in remote, rural regions of Nepal during the Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic lockdown by Nepal Government. With limited or no access of food and other essentials, Dalits and marginalized women and children are left without social safety nets. With this funding, ADWAN will be able to reach out and help with food and health and hygiene supplies to these vulnerable community to cope with pandemic lockdown.

organisation.narrative: Association for Dalit Women's Advancement of Nepal

mailing-address.narrative: ADWAN NEPAL, Shantimarga, Baluwatar, Kathmandu, 44616, Nepal

title.narrative: Sustain street kids impacted by COVID-19 in Congo

description.narrative: Prices of food and other essential items have quadrupled in Lubumbashi, D.R.Congo due to shortages, following the closure of the Zambian border, to prevent the spread of COVID-19. The city has seen a significant increase in insecurity, with increasing numbers of children in desperate need of support. We are setting up outreach centres to take food and clean water out to children in need, ensuring those with health needs get access to medical facilities. To make this happen, we need your help.

mailing-address.narrative: Ian Harvey, St Margaret's Centre, Brantingham Road, Manchester, M21 0TT, United Kingdom

description.narrative: Summary: During this very challenging time, due to the outbreak of the pandemic Novel Corona Virus (Covid 19) which has generally affected the entire nations of the earth. Our rural communities in Rivers state, is in a difficult situation getting complicated by the day. We, kindly, Request for Donation to Help Combat the Deadly COVID-19 Virus in a massive effort to help prevent, detect, and manage the novel coronavirus.

description.narrative: The proposed intervention is aiming to protect the 800 PRL, PRS and SRS refugee families during COVID 19 through promoting hygiene practices in the refugee camps. The intervention will be divided into three main components: - Identifying the most vulnerable 800 PRL and PRS households - Providing social distance hygiene awareness for 500 parents - Provision of domestic hygiene kits for 800 PRL, PRS and SRS households in 3 Palestinian refugee camps

title.narrative: The Salvation Army SE Michigan COVID-19 Response

description.narrative: The Salvation Army Eastern Michigan Division is working closely with state agencies to address the COVID-19 outbreak. We are consistently providing updates to the Federal Emergency Management Agency on our National Preparedness & Response status. Across the country, trained Salvation Army Emergency Response staff are on standby to assist if requested.

mailing-address.narrative: Christina Gallop, 16130 Northland Drive, Southfield, MI 48075, United States

title.narrative: Help fight the spread of Covid-19 in Guatemala

description.narrative: The coronavirus pandemic reached Guatemala in early March 2020. Since then, the government has been working to fight the spread of Covid-19 instituting measures such as: 1) closing the borders; 2) restricting public transportation; 3) setting a national curfew; 4) prohibiting inter-department travel and 5) requiring that all individuals wear masks in public spaces. This project will help low-income Guatemalans comply with government measures to fight the spread of Covid-19 in the country.

mailing-address.narrative: Colleen Supanich, Zona 3, 01 CJ Colonia Navidena, San Andres Itzapa, 04013, Guatemala

title.narrative: COVID-19 Emergency AID for Rural&Nomadic Nigeriens

description.narrative: As the coronavirus spreads, circumstances grow more dire for rural and nomadic peoples who already struggle to survive. The head of the World Food Program predicts "famines of biblical proportions" and, as they say in Niger, "an empty stomach has no ears." As food dwindles and prices soar, parents will not listen to governmental warnings to distance if it means letting their children go hungry. Keep communities safe with soap, hygiene training, & emergency food aid. YOU CAN SAVE LIVES.

organisation.narrative: Rain for the Sahel and Sahara

mailing-address.narrative: Katherine Kolios, PO Box 1503, Portsmouth, New Hampshire 03802, United States

title.narrative: Help animals in Venezuela as result of COVID19

description.narrative: COVID-19, or Coronavirus, has accentuated an already dire situation in Venezuela, especially for abandoned, community and rescue dogs & cats. During the past month (since mid-March), Venezuela is under a mandatory quarantine, which strongly limits the possibilities of survival to millions of dogs & and cats across the country. We are providing food, emergency vet care and support to thousands of animals, but we need your help to continue extending our reach.

mailing-address.narrative: Nebraska Villapol, AV PRIMERA AVENIDA CON PRIMERA TRANSVERSA EDIF PEBAMBU PISO 11 APT 114 URB LOS PALOS GRANDES, Caracas, 1060, Venezuela

title.narrative: COVID19 relief to 4,000 migrant workers Bangalore

description.narrative: The plight of India's migrant workers in the COVID 19 lockdown was highlighted on international news channels. Overnight migrant workers found themselves unable to work and not able to return to their villages. They are effectively trapped in migrant worker camps with no money, food, work or real chances of social distancing. To prevent hunger and destitution in Bangalore's migrant communities, Sampark plans to distribute essential food and provision to 12000 migrant workers and their families

mailing-address.narrative: Smita Premchander, 410, 2nd A Cross, 11th main, Block 3, Koramangala, Bangalore, Karnataka 560034, India

title.narrative: Help Feed Slum Families during this COVID 19

description.narrative: About a month ago the pandemic was first reported in Kenya. The effects of this has left most families suffering. These people relied on peasant business like: selling groceries at the evening market, some work in transport businesses having almost no income at all. Most of the people in Nyalenda work during the day to be able to purchase food for dinner. no money earned means no dinner that day. There is also lack PPE. We ask for your donations to cushion them from suffering

mailing-address.narrative: KOtieno Thomas, P.O BOX 3317, RINGROAD NYALENDA, KISUMU, Nyanza 40100, Kenya

The aim of the tele-health helpline is to provide the public with an alternative method to receive access to general healthcare and health advice.

title.narrative: COVID-19 FOOD DONATIONS CAMPAIGN IN NIGERIA

description.narrative: In many slums in Nigeria, millions of people who are affected by the over 2 months lockdown may not have been reached with the palliatives shared by the government for several reasons. One of them is that there is no access roads to where they live and were not captured in the Social Investment Program of the Federal Government. By this project, we wish to raise funds to enable us distribute food items, such as: rice, garri, yams, etc to 100 of such families selected from Imo State and the FCT.

description.narrative: COVID-19 is presenting a disparate threat to Palestinians in Israel and in the Occupied Territories. Adalah has been taking emergency legal action before the Israeli Supreme Court to demand access to healthcare, and to promote dignified living conditions and civil liberties protections. The government's deliberate neglect of Palestinians over decades through gross discrimination, and its protracted military Occupation, is being amplified during this crisis with potentially disastrous outcomes.

organisation.narrative: Adalah - The Legal Center for Arab Minority Rights in Israel

mailing-address.narrative: Rina Rosenberg (Jabareen), 94 Yaffa St, PO Box 8921, Haifa, 3109001, Israel

title.narrative: Help us keep fighting for the Amazon!

description.narrative: Help us keep fighting for the Amazon! We're an NGO working to protect the rainforest and, just like millions of others around the world, COVID-19 has been a major disruption. The funding we rely on has been hit particularly hard, putting at risk our ability to continue to conduct research for science-based conservation, to plant trees to recover the rainforest, and to provide high-quality environmental education to our region's kids. Can we count on your support to help us keep going?

organisation.narrative: Alliance for a Sustainable Amazon Inc.

title.narrative: COVID-19 CLEAR FACE MASK FOR DEAF

description.narrative: LIP-READING AND FACIAL EXPRESSION are very critical to deaf and hard of hearing 4 effective communication. We will produce face mask for deaf with the clear space that will enable deaf and hard of hearing to express themselves effectively through facial expression and lip-reading hence mitigating communication barrier that has existed. The organisation will assign trained deaf tailors to sew and produce face mask for deaf and distribute them free to hearing impaired and hard of hearing persons.

organisation.narrative: Kenya Christian School For The Deaf

title.narrative: Support daily wagers In India affected by Covid-19

description.narrative: Covid 19, an unprecedented disaster unfolding in India and globally as well, is a call for mankind to re-think, introspect, re-set ourselves to respond to this massive crisis and beyond. The biggest impact is emerging on a very large number of daily wagers, migrant workers who are out of jobs, and are going back to their villages. A lot of them are also stuck in the cities with hardly any resources. With the loss of livelihoods, a large number of them will now struggle to support their familie

title.narrative: COVID 3-D Printed Face Shields, Masks & Ear Guards

description.narrative: Aarogya Seva will be using the 3D printers they have stationed in various 3D-printing satellite centers across India to begin 3-D printing face shields, masks, ear guards and various other parts for medical equipment that is in high demand in the current COVID-19 pandemic.

mailing-address.narrative: Dayaprasad Kulkarni, 2307 S Rural Road, Tempe, AZ 85282, United States

title.narrative: Coronavirus Covid-19 Bubi Hospital Appeal Zimbabwe

description.narrative: As Zimbabwe prepares for the peak of the virus there is significant concern from Bubi District Hospital about their ability to meet the demands about to be put on their system. They have approached us and our partner Trinity Project to help provide essential equipment to save lives and protect front line workers.

mailing-address.narrative: Andrew Jackson, Oak House, 94 Park Lane, LEEDS, West Yorkshire LS3 1EL, United Kingdom

description.narrative: Aarogya Seva in collaboration with the Government of Karnataka proposes the commissioning of two refurbished, medically equipped, 9 bed quarantine buses and an ambulance with a ventilator system for the sole transportation and in transit SOS treatment of Covid - 19 patients and suspected cases from the source location to a secure medical facility for the city of Bangalore, Karnataka.

mailing-address.narrative: Dayaprasad Kulkarni, 2307 S Rural Road, Tempe, AZ 85282, United States

title.narrative: SUPPORT PEQUENOS PASOS- COVID 19 FOOD EMERGENCY

description.narrative: This project has the objective of providing monthly emergency food bags including non-perishable food items, cleaning supplies, diapers and personal care products to 850 low-income families and their children (approximately 5,000 people) that will face hunger during the COVID-19 Pandemic in Buenos Aires, Argentina

mailing-address.narrative: Florencia Pascuzzo, Peru 168 2 piso office 11, Acassuso, San Isidro, Buenos Aires 1640, Argentina

title.narrative: Help Avoid a COVID-19 Explosion Among Refugees

description.narrative: The massive number of refugees in Jordan make up one of the most vulnerable, high risk groups in the world to contract, die from, and rapidly spread the COVID-19 virus - in their population and the wider region. A deadly combination of risk factors creates an immediate and potent formula threatening to erupt into a major humanitarian catastrophe, posing a perilous threat in the world, if we do nothing. We are using tele-med to reach as many refugees with vital health care services as possible.

mailing-address.narrative: Steve Olweean, 12170 S. Pine Ayr Drive, % Steve S Olweean, President, Climax, Michigan 49034, United States

title.narrative: Help Rural Communities to Strive Against COVID-19

description.narrative: Considering the threat and sanitary crisis the Corona Virus poses, we resolve to engage in community outreach programmes. This is done through reaching out, mobilization, orientating and building the capacities of rural community members. There will be educational outreach trainings programmes, radio discussions, artwork, posters and leadership training interventions with emphasis on creating synergy among duty bearers of communities on fighting against the spread of COVID-19.

organisation.narrative: Movement towards Education and Youth Empowerment-Sierra Leone

mailing-address.narrative: Augustine Macarthy, 4 Mannah Lane, Kennedy Section., Bo City, 0000, Sierra Leone

title.narrative: COVID19 Relief: Holistic Healthcare in India

description.narrative: The COVID-19 pandemic is wrecking havoc on the poor and marginalized in India. This project exponentially expands access to healthcare, builds hand sanitizing stations in rural villages and suburban slums, provides nutritional supplements for those who can no longer work because of the shut down of Indian life, provides PPE for medical personnel and expands the reach of our clinics across the country.

mailing-address.narrative: Jacquelyn Cork, PO Box 3459, Virginia Beach, VA 23454, United States

title.narrative: SAVE THE WOMEN ECONOMY / SALVA LA ECONOMIA LOCAL

description.narrative: Este proyecto brindara capacitacion en linea a 125 emprendedoras de de 7 estados de Mexico. Les daremos herramientas para que transformen sus negocios a las nuevas necesidades del mercado derivado de COVID-19. / This project will provide online training to 125 female entrepreneurs from 7 states of Mexico. We will give them tools to transform their businesses to the new needs of the market derived from COVID-19.

organisation.narrative: Crea Comunidades de Emprendedores Sociales, A.C.

mailing-address.narrative: Marina Rodriguez Agner, Culiacan 15, Condesa, Mexico, Mexico City 06100, Mexico

title.narrative: Amar Seva Sangam's efforts to fight Covid 19.

description.narrative: The spread of the Corona virus world over is causing unimaginable human losses. The halt of the spread of the virus is utmost important and a priority over every other need. This is particularly so in the case of Persons with Disabilities, who are very vulnerable due to poor immunity. Added to this, the precautionary measures introduced by the governments, though absolutely necessary, have put the PwDs into more hardships.

mailing-address.narrative: Sankara Raman Srinivasan, Sulochana Gardens, 7-4-104B,, Tenkasi Road, Ayikudy, Tamil Nadu 627852, India

title.narrative: Emergency Aid in the Covid pandemic- South Asia

description.narrative: In the world, 129.2 million girls are out of school.In Southern Asia, girls are disadvantaged for almost all levels of education.The Coronavirus pandemic is likely to have a huge impact on them, with an increased risk of sexual exploitation, early pregnancy and forced marriage.The economic hardships caused by the crisis will likely induce some families to invest less in girls' education beside increasing their domestic and caring responsibilities. The project take place in India and Bangladesh

mailing-address.narrative: Alberto Barenghi, Via Ronchi, 17, ---, Milano, 20134, Italy

title.narrative: Food for workers starving in Pakistan due to COVID

description.narrative: COVID-19 has left daily wage workers starving. With no income whatsoever, they have no ability to feed families & are entirely dependent on food referred to locally as "rations" simply not to starve to death. Government-organized food rations are sadly being looted. DGF - Educate a Girl has key members on the ground working for this cause, despite the dangers, and this project fundraises for Heritage Foundation, The Garage School, SmileSunshine & HunarmaadKarachi.

organisation.narrative: Dawood Global Foundation - Educate a Girl

mailing-address.narrative: Tara Dawood, G3, Ground Floor, BRR Tower, Hassan Ali Street, off I I Chundrigar Road, Karachi, Sindh 74000, Pakistan

title.narrative: Periods Don't Stop for COVID19 Pandemic Help Girls

description.narrative: The consequences of the COVID-19 outbreak are felt most acutely by the marginalized, particularly women and girls. Due to lack of money and gender perspective hardly any government money goes toward adolescent girls. The lack of proper menstrual health management may lead to greater risks of infections. The limited food intake now would also aggravate the health of already malnourished girls. We are planning to provide sanitary pads and supplementary nutrition for 1000 poor adolescent girls.

organisation.narrative: Center for Women's Development and Research

mailing-address.narrative: K. R. Renuka, 23. Jayaram Street, Vasanth Apartments 'D' 1st floor, Kuppam Beach Road, Thiruvnamiyur, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600041, India

title.narrative: BE THERE - support young people during coronavirus

description.narrative: When the world is told to distance yourselves and remain isolated, young people living in challenging circumstances feel heightened levels of anxiety and loneliness. The coronavirus crisis is making life tough for young people, so now is a critical time for us to support our students. We plan to offer online music-making and social sessions for EVERY young person. That's 350 students and 475 sessions every week! Please will you "BE THERE" to help us support young people when they need us most?

mailing-address.narrative: Sahana Gero, 58 Kimber Rd, Wandsworth, London, London SW18 4PP, United Kingdom

title.narrative: Help Haiti's first line response to Covid-19

description.narrative: The head of the Covid-19 effort in Haiti is hoping for availability of 3,000 hospital beds. There are actually only 70 beds currently available, of these 40 are provided by St Luke's Hospital. We are gearing up to provide additional beds, we have separate staff for the COVID-19 patients, and we are desperately looking to be ready with equipment (mostly PPE) for our employees. Community support remains a central focus of St Luke's programs: we distribute chlorox for handwashing, masks and food

organisation.narrative: Fondazione Francesca Rava Nph Italia Onlus

person-name.narrative: Fondazione Francesca Rava Nph Italia Onlus

mailing-address.narrative: Fondazione Francesca Rava Nph Italia Onlus, Viale Premuda 38/A, Milano, Italy 20129, Italy

title.narrative: Supporting Daphe to come out of an abusive home.

description.narrative: Daphe a sixteen year old girl living in Uganda, she was defiled and gave birth to a baby boy now 4 month. since then she has been subjected to repeated physical and psychological torture by her father. Due to COVID-19 pandemic stress at home, the father has chased Daphe and the baby away from the only place she calls home. we want to support daphe to have shelter, food, clothes and seed capital to start her own business and leave a free and dignified life with her baby.

mailing-address.narrative: Tumukunde Loyce, Galt road, kabale road, Mbarara Municipality, Mbarara 256, Uganda

description.narrative: Waste collectors are critical in a circular economy, yet are among the most marginalized people. Many are women and children living at the fringes of society, unable to access health care and education. Yet they play a vital role in their communities by removing waste and keeping materials out of the environment. They aren't equipped to be on the frontlines of the COVID-19 pandemic. We ask for your help to support their immediate needs while advancing better future conditions.

mailing-address.narrative: Kayla O'Neill, 1110 Vermont Avenue NW, Suite 550, Washington, D.C. 20005, United States

title.narrative: COVID-19: WE TAKE CARE OF CASE RONALD'S FAMILIES!

description.narrative: Italy is one of the most affected countries by COVID-19, with more than 228.000 cases. In these times of great emergency, Fondazione per l'Infanzia Ronald McDonald Italia wants to give its support, by continuing to help and to take care of the community and, in particular, of all families who have to travel far from home and spend several weeks or months to get treatment for their seriously ill or injured children.

organisation.narrative: Fondazione per l'Infanzia Ronald McDonald Italia

title.narrative: Support Healthy Smiles for Children in Ecuador

description.narrative: The COVID-19 pandemic has unfortunately limited Global Smile Foundation's ability to conduct our scheduled missions in Guayaquil, Ecuador. We continue to provide much-needed care for our patients and their families via Telehealth & also provide them with infant formula, specialized bottles, medications & other necessary supplies.

mailing-address.narrative: Lisa Crist, 101 Access Road, Suite 205, Norwood, MA 02062, United States

description.narrative: Heroes for All has been involved helping the struggling population of daily wage earners and unemployed providing 1 wk supply of food items since March 18. 1 bag cost $5.81 The volunteers and members of the organization is going door to door handing over the food so that the people who are in crisis do not need to come out of their homes. We successfully managed to support +3000 families across Bangladesh with whatever fund we managed to raise and continuing the distribution in remote villages.

mailing-address.narrative: Rehnuma Karim, 160 Evergreen Rd, Green Road, Dhaka , 1205, Brockport, NY 14420, United States

title.narrative: COVID-19 Emergency School Meal Delivery Fund

description.narrative: In the USA, 124K schools closed due to COVID-19 yet continue school meal operations for 30M students who rely on them. There is an urgent need for resources to distribute healthy meals to kids outside the school building. To help schools maintain continuity of school meal programs, GENYOUth launched our COVID-19 Emergency School Meal Delivery Fund to help schools provide nourishing meals in their communities. Over 13K grant applications have been submitted, requesting support totaling over $37M.

mailing-address.narrative: Ann Marie Krautheim, 515 Madison Avenue, 26th Floor, New York, NY 10022, United States

title.narrative: COVID-19 RESPONSE OF RESOURCE LESS IN POOR COUNTRY

description.narrative: PROJECT SUMMARY Currently as the whole world is focusing on the combating of world pandemic through any possible methods to save lives. Ethiopian is also on the way of struggling to scape from the world pandemic COVID-19 as cases are increasing day to day and deaths are already recorded. HIYAW FIKIR YELIJOCH ENA YEWETATOCH LIMAT MAHIBER working with more than 170 children and with their parents. Our beneficiaries are parts of the community who are poorest of poor people even don't have to eat.

organisation.narrative: HIYAW FIKIR YELIJOCH ENA YEWETATOCH LIMAT MAHIBER

mailing-address.narrative: Wondwossen Nigatu, Franko road, Goro Kebele, Adama, Oromiya 774, Ethiopia

description.narrative: Our world faces an unprecedented challenge in the face of COVID-19. As a global community, we share your focus on individual safety and the health of our world. Atlas Corps is also focused on the safety and welfare of our Fellows. We currently have 70 Fellows in active service in the USA. They continue to serve from virtual offices. Atlas Corps continues to support them. We also maintain our focus on developing leaders, strengthening organizations. Today, we ask you for a small gift of support.

mailing-address.narrative: Abby Robinson, 99 M Street SE 4th Floor, Washington, DC 20003, United States

title.narrative: Provide baby formula to 200 families in Thailand

description.narrative: Ubon Ratchathani is home to many Thai migrant workers who have lost their jobs and returned home from Bangkok due to do the COVID-19 pandemic. We have an already-existing infant formula program in partnership with the Thai government's Department of Social Development & Welfare. We will be delivering food and infant formula with the Thai government to families who have been identified as most in need. We hope to bridge the gap for families until they can go back to work when the economy reopens.

mailing-address.narrative: Marcus Fey, 97/4 Chayangkun 40, T. Nai Mueang, A. Mueang, Ubon Ratchathani 34000, Thailand

title.narrative: Provide medical supplies to Honduran Hospital

description.narrative: The Hospital Escuela is the largest government run hosptial in Central America. On the best of days they do not have the supplies they need to take care of patients. Parents have to bring in wound supplies, food, and necesissities. They are not allowed to stay with their children at night. It is a teaching hospital and many of the physcians work tirelessly, often giving up their own practice for part of the day. They need supplies. Gloves, masks, protective equipment, disinfectant during COVID.

mailing-address.narrative: Gayle Savage Davidson, 1203 Antler Dr., Tupelo, MS 38804, United States

description.narrative: The Alvaro Wille Trejos Community Empowerment and Studies Center (CEEC-AWT), our station in the Osa Peninsula, functions as a center of opportunities for local organizations in Costa Rica. Since the worldwide emergency of COVID 19, the income from tourism activity has suffered a huge drop, which has left all who depend on this activity in the zone in an economically difficult situation, as they no longer receive almost 100% of the income they expected for this year.

mailing-address.narrative: Sergio Zúñiga, Frente al Colegio de Ingenieros y Arquitectos en Curridabat, San Jose, Costa Rica, 236-1002 Paseo de los Estudiantes, Curridabat, San Jose 236-1002 SJ, CR, Costa Rica

title.narrative: COVID-19 Emergency Response in Palestine & Lebanon

description.narrative: Poverty, displacement, occupation, and siege magnify the impact of the coronavirus a thousand times. We are responding to requests from community organizations to help protect children and families in Palestine and refugees in Lebanon by providing medical aid, personal hygiene and cleaning kits, food parcels, and more.

mailing-address.narrative: Josie Shields-Stromsness, 1101 8th Street, #100, Berkeley, CA 94710, United States

description.narrative: Waste pickers' livelihoods consist of combing landfills and neighborhoods to collect pieces of plastic trash. Individually, these items are almost worthless, but if enough are bundled together, they may be sold for recycling. These communities provide a vital service but are compromised by their living conditions and marginalized by their lack of status. They are being severely impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic and need urgent support to deal with its consequences.

mailing-address.narrative: John Ehrmann, PO Box 1829, Dillon, CO 80435, United States

description.narrative: While responsible for delivering the majority of the world's materials to the recycling value chain, informal collectors are also critical to maintaining public health and sanitation. They are often marginalized in their own communities and have limited access to basic needs such as food, education, and healthcare. In Ghana, the COVID-19 pandemic is deeply affecting the lives and livelihoods of the waste collector community and they need immediate support to cope with the crisis.

mailing-address.narrative: John Holm, 99 M St SE, Suite 400, Washington, DC, DC 20003, United States

description.narrative: This project will support Cambodian Children's Fund's effort to protect the vulnerable community of Steung Meanchey from COVID-19 by providing hygiene and sanitation products and resources to students and families to ensure they are educated and updated regarding COVID-19, they remain safe and healthy, and to prevent the spread of the virus across vulnerable populations in Cambodia.

mailing-address.narrative: Cambodian Children's Fund, 2461 Santa Monica Blvd., #833, Santa Monica, CA 90404, United States

description.narrative: Ecuador is one of the Latin American countries most affected by the coronavirus, is in the sixth week of isolation. Guayaquil is the city hardest hit by the coronavirus. In mid-March, with the cases increasing, the Ecuadorian Government closed its air and maritime border, declared a health emergency and a state of emergency, with which the mobilization was restricted. As of April 23, the number of infected is 22,106 and 1,636 deceased aproximately.

organisation.narrative: Israel Foundation - CDC Community Development Center

description.narrative: This funding will help us buy and supply essential needs like food, soap and locally made masks to our direct beneficiaries and their families totaling to 5,000 girls who have been affected by the COVID-19, due to the fact that their type of work is hand to mouth earning. We also get our earned revenue from the entertainment industry, we stopped earning in February and our lock down has been temporarily extended. No one is certain about tomorrow and sure when this will end.

title.narrative: Mindful Action: COVID-19 Emergency Relief Fund

description.narrative: In response to the unbearable levels of suffering among the poorest and most marginalized communities in South and Southeast Asia, INEB has set up a COVID-19 Emergency Relief Fund. Our goal is to be able to increase our response to the most urgent needs for food supplies, hygiene and sanitary supplies, in addition to medicine, hospital beds, and toilets. We know this is a difficult time to ask for your support, but this is the moment when even a small contribution can save lives.

description.narrative: This project will feed the hunger and sanitation support for the small farmers, agricultural daily wages labourers, and informal sector workers whose are affected by COVID-19 crisis in India. In India 93% of workers whose are lost their income and do not get a regularly monthly pay.

title.narrative: Pandemic Food Relief for Families in Rwanda

description.narrative: We are in uncharted waters. COVID-19 is now present in nearly every country in the world. Everyday needs present an even greater challenge than before the pandemic, and the coming months are filled with uncertainty. In early March, the families we serve in Rwanda voiced their fears about the virus and its impact on them. The Rwandan government locked down the country on March 21. Our families have lost the ability to earn any income whatsoever, and they desperately need our help.

mailing-address.narrative: Nancy Zeller, 116 Paine Rd, Westmoreland, NH 03467, United States

description.narrative: The COVID-19 crisis has been affecting everyone's way of living, but it is especially difficult for people who are already vulnerable. Association for Aid and Relief, Japan (AAR Japan) is supporting persons with disabilities (PWDs) in Japan by providing hygiene items such face masks and other sanitary items to protect themselves.

organisation.narrative: Association for Aid and Relief, Japan (AAR Japan)

mailing-address.narrative: YUI HIRADE, 7F, Mizuho Building, 2-12-2 Kamiosaki, Shinagawa-ku, Tokyo 1410024, Japan

title.narrative: COVID19: Food relief for vulnerable Australians

description.narrative: COVID-19, and the resulting mass unemployment being experienced across the country has been the catalyst in the exponential increase in food insecurity. Foodbank is in urgent need of funding to source key staple foods that don't come in sufficient quantities via traditional rescue channels. This will enable Foodbank to provide a sustainable supply in a variety of essential foods that are nutritious and convenient for vulnerable Australians during these extraordinary and unprecedented times.

mailing-address.narrative: Sindy Dupagunta, 11 Julius Ave, North Ryde, NSW 2113, Australia

title.narrative: COVID-19 Elderly and Disabled Veteran Supplies

description.narrative: We have been feeding the elderly and disabled veterans of North Carolina since March 3rd, 2020. We have fed 256 veterans and first responders in-need by purchasing meals over 3-4 weeks. The word has gotten out about our efforts and our phones are ringing nonstop with requests. Our goal is to take care of as many families as we can for the duration of the virus and stay-at-home protocol. We have partnered with Carolina Farm Trust, a nonprofit, on this mission as well and want to raise funds.

organisation.narrative: US Military Veterans Hall of Fame

mailing-address.narrative: Curtis Drafton, 4522 Carnfeld LN, Charlotte, NC 28215, United States

title.narrative: Relief, Wellbeing and Empowerment During Pandemic

description.narrative: Covid - 19 Pandemic, a Global health crisis is affecting people's health, the economy and the society. Your contributions will help conduct awareness programs through community outreach programs. Address mental health challenges, enable optimum potential of the human systems, fortify immunity and exponentially increase the ability of critically ill patients to recover from the condition through Aashwasan services.

mailing-address.narrative: Ravi Ramamurthy, #12 5th Main Grape Garden, Kammanahalli, Bangalore, Karnataka 560084, India

title.narrative: Fight the spread of COVID-19 in Rural Haiti

description.narrative: The number of people infected with the COVID-19 virus in Haiti continues to grow. Our rural partners cannot stay sheltered in place as their livelihood depends entirely on them being out in the fields working. We are taking measures to provide members of 60 organizations (over 3,000 families) with the education needed on the pandemic and the necessary equipment to protect themselves, their families and communities.

mailing-address.narrative: Josette Perard, 1050 Connecticut Ave NW, Suite 500, Washington, DC 20036, United States

title.narrative: COVID-19 Response for First Mile waste collectors

description.narrative: Global response efforts are underway for COVID-19 but the poor are disproportionately left behind. The First Mile, an initiative of WORK and Thread, supports waste collectors in Haiti, Honduras, and Taiwan. This network of thousands of women and men working hard to clean up the environment to make ends meet mostly lack an identity and access to safety net services. Your donation supports our comprehensive response of prevention, treatment, and access to medical care, and long-term support.

mailing-address.narrative: Christina Marsico, 7800 Susquehanna Street, Suite 502, Pittsburgh, PA 15208, United States

title.narrative: Supporting Waste Pickers through the COVID crisis

description.narrative: In many parts of SE Asia and Latin America, informal waste collectors are the backbone of the waste management system, salvaging materials and keeping them out of the ocean and environment. Now they are also on the frontline of the COVID19 crisis - vulnerable and exposed. The Circulate Initiative is working with partners in Indonesia, Vietnam, and Argentina to get food, protective gear, and hygiene kits to these communities now, and to help them build a better future post-crisis.

mailing-address.narrative: Susan Ruffo, 60 E 42nd St, Ste 2410, New York, NY 10016, United States

description.narrative: This pandemic has shown us that education is vital as many children today cannot go to school. As many of you know, we had to suspend classes at our daycare and preschool to ensure the safety of our students, staff, and families. Thankfully, our program has continued through distance learning. But, parents have had to dedicate their time to educating their children instead of working. Because of this, our families are in desperate need of additional support during this quarantine.

mailing-address.narrative: Rachel Frey, Enrique Velasco Ibarra 9, Colonia Santa Julia, San Miguel de Allende, Guanajuato 37750, Mexico

title.narrative: Emergency Response to COVID-19 in Moya Communities

description.narrative: A GG micro-grant has helped Moya Centre initiate a Covid-19 emergency response plan. Now we must scale it up. We have a responsibility as a community-based org. to support those who are in desperate need of assistance during this unprecedented time. With a national lock down in place to flatten the curve, many guardians of Moya children are out of work. Moya has switched gears to provide immediate relief in the form of food and hygiene parcels, as well as education, for families most in need.

organisation.narrative: Moya Trust (also known as Moya Centre)

mailing-address.narrative: Katelyn Panzarella, Corner Plot of Malandela's Farm, Mahlanya, H124, Eswatini

description.narrative: Deep concern over a potential rapid spread of coronavirus in Yemen. "The factors are all here. Low levels of general immunity, high levels of acute vulnerability & a fragile, overwhelmed health system," said Ms. Lise Grande, the HC in Yemen. The basic materials and aids are not available due to this civil war. SYS presents this program to combat the spread of infectious diseases and provide some means of prevention in many neighborhoods, mosques, restaurants, as well as the markets.

organisation.narrative: Support Yemeni Society Organization for Development SYS

mailing-address.narrative: Ahmed Al-Qadhi, Hadda St. Next to Maktabaty, P O Box 1715, Sana'a, 967, Yemen

title.narrative: COVID-19 Response: Help Afghan Girls and Families

description.narrative: Sahar currently serves 25,000 girls in Afghanistan yearly. During the pandemic we are launching a COVID 19 response campaign that needs your support so that we can provide timely assistance to a population that does not have adequate access to healthcare. Our Afghan team will provide health education about the virus including hygiene and social distancing within the cultural and family structures. We will also purchase PPEs and soap from female entrepreneurs and distribute them to those in need.

mailing-address.narrative: Ginna Brelsford, P.O. Box 17672, Seattle, WA 98127, United States

title.narrative: Emergency Seed Bank to avert famine in Haiti.

description.narrative: Poor rural families and farmers risk serious threat to their food and nutrition security that could escalate into famine in the aftermath of COVID-19. Undernourishment and a significant drop in agricultural production rates will result if an aggressive recovery plan is not implemented to avoid sending struggling farmers even deeper into poverty traps and malnutrition. The Seed Bank uses an inter-generational approach to strengthen community and serve as a model for social and behavioral changes.

mailing-address.narrative: Gabrielle Aurel, 637 Monroe Street, Newport, KY 41071, United States
